messages.content:
summarize this as a one line "gap" analysis for the module that we are turning more sustainable oriented: 1. Design Thinking	Slide 12-13: Design Sprint - Empathize Stage	Lack of environmental considerations in user interviews
"● Program Overview 
● Design thinking process and plan"	Slide 16: Design Sprint - Ideate Stage	Lack of prompts for sustainable solutions
	User Persona Template	Template excludes environmental factors
	Facilitator Notes - User Research Planning Session	No guidance on environmental questions in research

Gap Analysis: The module lacks environmental considerations in user interviews, ideation prompts for sustainability, environmental factors in the user persona template, and guidance on sustainability-focused research questions.

summarize this as a one line "gap" analysis for the module that we are turning more sustainable oriented, frame it as a suggested area of improvement in it's "greenification": 
[[[1. Design Thinking	Slide 12-13: Design Sprint - Empathize Stage	Lack of environmental considerations in user interviews
"● Program Overview 
● Design thinking process and plan"	Slide 16: Design Sprint - Ideate Stage	Lack of prompts for sustainable solutions
	User Persona Template	Template excludes environmental factors
	Facilitator Notes - User Research Planning Session	No guidance on environmental questions in research]]]
keep it short
The module lacks environmental considerations in user interviews, ideation prompts, and research planning—suggest integrating sustainability-focused questions and criteria.

do the same for the proposed solutions: "Content Changes	Activity Modifications	Reasoning	Worksheet to Make
Revise interview instructions on slides to add one question, e.g., "How does your morning routine affect your energy use or waste?"	N/A	Introduces environmental factors early, helping entrepreneurs identify user needs tied to resource efficiency—a key to cost-effective solutions.	None"
Revise interview instructions to include an environmental question, integrating resource efficiency awareness early to help entrepreneurs identify sustainable opportunities.

Same for this one: 3. The Survey	Survey Goal Definition (Slide 5)	Market research is not explicitly linked to business risk reduction
"● Steps to creating a survey
● Survey component
● How to get respondents"	Survey Design & Components (Slide 9)	No emphasis on cost efficiency or risk data collection
	Survey Testing & Feedback (Slide 13)	No clear method to assess business efficiency insights from the survey
	Where to Post Surveys (Slide 15)	No mention of targeted industry networks for sourcing efficiency-focused data
	Survey Review & Wrap-up (Slide 18)	No emphasis on business efficiency takeaways
The module lacks links between market research and business risk reduction—suggest integrating cost efficiency, risk data collection, and targeted industry networks for efficiency-focused insights.
We don't want to suggest till later
The module does not explicitly connect market research to business risk reduction, cost efficiency, or targeted data collection for business insights.

do the same for this one [[[Understanding markets could very well involve elements of the demand for green solutions, some of which might even be economically interesting! At least in the longer run. Here you can introduce the concept of what a green business is and how it can support accessing “green” markets and enhance competitiveness (e.g. by increasing resource efficiency, reducing vulnerability to climate change, etc.). . You can also add more information about green markets in Iraq, e.g. on solar energy, water efficiency systems, energy efficiency, etc. Or on changes in demand for green products. (See p.7-9 ‘Green Business Booklet’)	4. Market Research	Market trends analysis (Slides 5-8)	No risk-based approach to market shifts, lacks cost-reduction perspective on sustainability.
	"● Understand your market
● Market analyses and market size
● Competitive benchmarking"	Comparing business strategies (Slides 10-13)	No mention of how competitors leverage cost savings from efficiency, missing business incentives for sustainability.
		Startup risks & financial hurdles (Slides 14-15)	No mention of how climate trends could create business disruptions, such as energy costs, supply chain issues, or regulatory requirements.
		Estimating costs & financial sustainability (Slides 16-19)	No mention of long-term cost savings from resource efficiency investments.
		Final project assessment	Sustainability is not positioned as a strategic advantage in business models.]]]

The module lacks a risk-based approach to market shifts, cost-saving incentives for sustainability, and the strategic advantages of green business models, including climate-related risks and long-term resource efficiency.

same for: 5. Reframe	"User Research Analysis
"	Lack of integration of external risks (e.g., climate, supply chain disruptions).
"● Analyze user research
● Custom journey steps and map
● Build your business"	"Customer Journey Mapping Exercise
"	No structured way to assess efficiency and resource risks in the journey.
	How Might We (HMW) Statements	HMW statements focus on user experience but miss business continuity risks.
	Stakeholder Identification	Limited consideration of strategic partnerships for operational efficiency.
	Business Model Development	No explicit link between efficiency improvements and long-term business viability.
The module lacks integration of external risks, resource efficiency assessments, and strategic partnerships, missing connections between sustainability and long-term business viability.

same for [[[6. Creativity and Ideation	Rapid Brainstorming	Brainstorming lacks focus on market trends and efficiency-based innovation.
"● Rapid brainstorming (what if?)
● Idea filtration
● Challenging assumption"	Idea Filtration	Idea selection does not incorporate risk mitigation strategies.
	Challenge Assumptions	Assumption-challenging lacks structured business risk assessment.]]]
The module lacks a focus on market trends, efficiency-based innovation, and risk mitigation in brainstorming, idea filtration, and assumption-challenging exercises.
simpler language
The module doesn’t include market trends, efficiency, or risk awareness in brainstorming, idea selection, and challenging assumptions.

same for [[[7. The Pitch	Business Storytelling	No explicit link to market trends or risk factors.
"● Storytelling
● Know your audience
● Pitch key points
● Judging criteria"	Know Your Audience	Limited focus on investor priorities beyond financials.
	Judging Criteria	No criteria addressing long-term business viability.
	1-Sentence Pitch	Does not encourage efficiency or differentiation.
	3-Minute Pitch	Limited emphasis on risk reduction as a business strategy.
	Investor Q&A	No focus on how to answer efficiency-related questions from investors.
	Pitch Deck	Lacks structured approach to presenting efficiency improvements.]]]
The module doesn’t connect pitching to market trends, risk factors, efficiency, or long-term business viability.

again with additional context [[[Definitely a place to think in some green! Being the green solution/brand (while not necessarily the more expensive one) should bring some potential for attracting certain customer elements... At least it could be considered, whether there’s a value add in a green brand	7. The Pitch	Business Storytelling	No explicit link to market trends or risk factors.
	"● Storytelling
● Know your audience
● Pitch key points
● Judging criteria"	Know Your Audience	Limited focus on investor priorities beyond financials.
		Judging Criteria	No criteria addressing long-term business viability.
		1-Sentence Pitch	Does not encourage efficiency or differentiation.
		3-Minute Pitch	Limited emphasis on risk reduction as a business strategy.
		Investor Q&A	No focus on how to answer efficiency-related questions from investors.
		Pitch Deck	Lacks structured approach to presenting efficiency improvements.]]]
The module misses opportunities to highlight sustainability as a competitive advantage in pitching—there’s no link to market trends, investor interest in efficiency, or risk reduction strategies.

same [[[8. Your Brand	Brand Identity & Messaging	No structured approach to risk management in branding.
"● Build a brand
● New value proposition
● Mission and values"	Unique Value Proposition	No explicit focus on competitive advantages through efficiency.
	Mission Statement Exercise	No link to operational risk or long-term business positioning.
	Positioning Statement	No direct link to financial or operational sustainability.
	Branding Case Studies	Examples focus mainly on aesthetics and recognition.]]]
The module lacks a focus on sustainability and efficiency in branding—there’s no connection to risk management, competitive advantages, or long-term business viability.
